Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2008 05:52PM Pepper_B wrote: I work as a law enforcement officer specializing in sexual assault. I recommend that you seeks some form of professional help to deal with your trauma. Most states have a crisis center that you can call who are able to provide you with resources. If you are really concerned about this lump then you need to see a doctor. You can ask for a nurse to be present during the exam. You have to remember that this doctor's touch is a theraputic touch to find out if this lump is cancer.
Posts.Title: Very worried and Scared whyne9 Pepper_B

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2008 06:20PM Pepper_B wrote: A radiologist tech should not be giving out results. They are there to take the mammo and give the results to your doctor that requested your mammo. Get ahold of him and ask him what the nexxt spet should be. If he request that you wait - then get a second opinion.
